discourse_list.title: Fix links to the types of risks and risk teams at the "Collateral and Risk" page

content.content: Hey guys, I was thoroughly studying vaults and collaterals and ended up here https://makerdao.world/en/collateral-and-risk/types-of-risk and here https://makerdao.world/en/collateral-and-risk/risk-teams The page looks a bit abandoned because links to “Types of Risk” and “Risk Teams” lead to 404 pages. Sorry if I duplicated the bug that had already been posted here (while “similar topics search” showed me no relevant answers).
Thanks for bringing it up! I think there are indeed some webpages and links that need to be fixed.

This site (makerdao.world) is not being maintained by CES, it was owned by the recently offboarded Content Production CU. I don’t know what the future plans are of this portal in particular - currently it has no owner as far as I know. However, you can read about different collateral teams and their responsibility at collateral.makerdao.com, which is maintained by CES (albeit in need of a soon to come update).

Thanks a lot for the updated link! I’ve digged the “offboarded” website because it’s the first one in Google  Btw, this page of the “official” website has a lot of broken images: Collateral Risk Assessment Guide - Collateral Onboarding Check the screenshot below:  Screen Shot 2022-02-21 at 16.40.43817×621 41 KB  I’m using the latest version of Google Chrome for Mac OS

@lollike — and there’s a link to this page http://makervaults.descipher.io/ from this one Collateral Risk Assessment Guide - Collateral Onboarding http://makervaults.descipher.io/ shows an application error:  Sorry for being so nerdy, but the topic is important for me (and maybe not only me  )
Thank you for flagging this. As I noted above, these docs also need to be updated - it’s in our backlog
@lollike Ser, wen IPFS, ENS based domains, Ceramic-styled Maker Forum/Discord? Prob asking for too much — but hopefully on CES/SES “to do list/backlog”?
Sorry, maybe asking for too much but would love to have a link to CES backlog to avoid extra obvious questions

@flipflopflapdelegate We’re busy onboarding RWA!  I’m not going to speak for the whole CU, but personally I don’t see those specific things as big priority according to the CES mandate - we’re deeply focused on scaling Dai supply. However, we are going to build some RWA related UIs, so we might use IPFS/ENS at some point in the future if the need is there. @George_Goognin Our tool (Shortcut) is not for public consumption, but we recently started sharing the overarching milestones and updates on a biweekly basis which contains screenshots from Shortcut     CES Sprint Update #1 (2022/Q1 - Jan 31st to Feb 11th 2022) Collateral Engineering Services       As defined in the Collateral Management Lifecycle (CML) post, the life cycle implies two big focus areas for CES: Collateral Onboarding and Collateral Maintenance. Within these areas we categorize our output into a set of deliverables(COD1-3, CMD1, CMO1).  From now on, CES will provide a bi-monthly update synced with the end of each sprint (2 weeks work cycle).   [roadmap-2022-02-16]  Roadmap: collapse version - only milestones   Collateral Onboarding  COD1 - COB Process  [roadmap-2022-02-16] E…
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
